div.l: Oure maıı̄unciple I hope he wele be ded
Swa werkis ay / þᵉ wangis in hese hed
And þ̉erfore is I come ⁊and ek aleyn
To grynde oure corn ⁊and carie it hōm a geyn
I prey ȝow spede vs hene as ȝe may
It schal be don ꝙquod symkyn be myn fay
What wel ȝe don whil þᵗat it is in hande
By god ryȝt by þᵉ hopyr wele I stande
Quod Ion ⁊and sen how þᵉ corn goth in
Ȝit saw I neuere be myn fadir kyn
How þᵗat þe hopir wagis to ⁊and fra
Aleȳn answerede ⁊and seyde wilt þᵘou swa
Thānne wele I be beneth bi myn croun
And sen how þᵗat þᵉ mele fallyth don
In to þe trow þᵗat schal ben myn dysport
For Iohn yfayth I may ben of ȝore sort
I is as ille a mellere as is ȝe
This mellere smylede of here nysetee
And thouȝte al þis it nys don but for awyle
They wene þᵗat no man may hēm be gyle
But be myn thryft ȝit wele I blere here ye
For al þe sleyȝte in here philosofye
The more queynte crokede þᵗat þey make
The more wele I stele whan I take
In stede of floᵘur / ȝit wele I ȝeue hēmm bren
The gretteste clerkys ben not wyseste men
As whilom to þe wolf þus spak þe mare
Of al here art I coıı̄unte not a tare
Out at þe dore he goth ful pryuyly
Whan þᵗat he saw hese tyme softely
He lokyth vp ⁊and doıı̄un tyl he haue foıı̄unde
The clerkys hors þ̉ere as it stod I bounde
Be hȳnde þe melle vndyr a leuesel
And to þe hors he goth fayre ⁊and wel
He strepith of þe brydil ryght a non
And whān þe hors was los he gȳnnyth gon
